code:
import time
import pyautogui

# Press Windows key to open Start menu
pyautogui.press('win')
time.sleep(1)

# Type "WhatsApp" to search for the application
pyautogui.write('WhatsApp', interval=0.1)
time.sleep(1)

# Press Enter to launch WhatsApp
pyautogui.press('enter')
time.sleep(3)

# Verify WhatsApp window appears by checking for a unique element
try:
    # Look for WhatsApp title bar or icon on screen
    whatsapp_found = pyautogui.locateOnScreen('whatsapp_icon.png', confidence=0.8)
    if whatsapp_found:
        print("EXECUTION_SUCCESS")
    else:
        # Fallback: check if any window with WhatsApp in title exists
        import pygetwindow as gw
        whatsapp_windows = [w for w in gw.getAllTitles() if 'WhatsApp' in w]
        if whatsapp_windows:
            print("EXECUTION_SUCCESS")
        else:
            print("FAILED: WhatsApp window not detected")
except Exception as e:
    print(f"FAILED: {e}")

result.stdout: FAILED: The confidence keyword argument is only available if OpenCV is installed.
